Svart med kompakt brunt skum. Duft av karamell, tobakk, kaffe og vanilje. Samme toner i smaken. Godt karbonert og skummelt lettdrikkelig.

Color: black
Foam: frothy w/ brownish head
Smell: rye bread, barrel, whisky, greens, liquorice, soy sauce, hint of caramel, chocolate..
Taste: sweet malts, chocolate, bitter hops, wood and liquorice
Soft carbonation. Alcohol is not noticeable - warms nicely at the end. Balanced beer and not very bitter in the end. Quality brew.

33cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Dark brown colour with a thin beige head.
Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, oak, whiskey.
Taste is roasted malt, sweet, dark fruits, chocolate, whiskey, oak.
Full body, soft carbonation.
Dobry porter, ale jak na te oceny spodziewałem się więcej. Jest niby co ma być, ale szału nie ma.

330 ml bottle.

Dark brown nearly black with some sediments. Off-white head. Smooth taste and easy to drink.

piwo z ewidentną wadą w postaci przesadzonego wysycenia. smakuje niezgorzej, głównie wiśniowo, alkohol rozgrzewający. nie jest to stylowy porter, ale byłby do przyjęcia, gdyby nie totalne przegazowanie
On tap. Dark brown color with one finger biege head. Aroma of figs. Big taste of figs, roasted malts, ends with almost a burnt taste.

bottle. Malty. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, cacao, coffee, overriped fruits and liqourice with notes of oak and bourbon. Light citrus hops. Starts heavy sweet but finish bitter with lingering roasted notes. Medium body and oily texture. Fizzy carbonation. A nice one...

Kulsort, rolig og ufiltreret Imperial Porter med minimal og flygtig mocca-farvet skumtop på 3 mm. Svinder hurtigt til kant og overflade. 
Fine noter af amerikansk whiskey spreder sig om bordet og rammer næsen. Dernæst lette noter af kaffe, frugt-ditto á la hindbær samt hårdt ristet malt. Fin aroma, men ikke så kraftig som ventet. 
Dejlig bittersød smag med noter af mørk chokolade, kaffe, whiskey (Jack Daniels) og egetræ fra lagringen. Let syrlig og bitter afslutning i et vel balanceret bryg. 
Tydelig alkolhol efter "aftemperering", men ganske elegant samt lang eftersmag. 
Lækker blød mundfølelse. Brygget er let karboneret, konsistensen er cremet, og kroppen fyldig og rund. Afslutningen er, som nævnt, bittersød og lang. 
Overall: Elegant kraftig Porter, som bør parres med dessert én dag. Lidt sødere end jeg huskede den, men elegant integreret fadlagrings indtryk. 
0.5 L, flaske, 10.0 % ABV, BB: 11/02/2024, nydt på Svane Pub på Strandvejen på Østerbro, CPH.

Data ważności:  26.10.2021 
 Kolor:  Ciemnobrązowy, klarowny z delikatnymi przebłyskami u nasady trunku. 
 Piana:  Ciemnokremowa, niska, szybko opada do krążka.
Drobne pęcherzyki powietrza budują grubą oponkę. Przy przechyleniu kielicha na jego krawędziach malują się umiarkowane wzorki. 
 Zapach:  Po nosie uderza konkretna beczkowa wanilia, dębowa beczka, drewno.
Nuty whiskey wychodzą wyraźnie przed szereg. W tle jest słodki karmel, lekkie toffi i mnóstwo czekolady. 
 Smak:  W smaku beczka, intensywna, trwała.
Konkretny kopniak między nogi od nut mokrego drewna, dębiny, lekkiej wanillii.
Po przełknięciu czuć potęgę ciemnych owoców. Na pierwszy plan wybija się wiśnia, kwaskowata, soczysta. Równoważy ją po chwili nieco słodsza czereśnia.
Dalej odrobina karmelu, toffi i niskie posmaki czekoladowe. Tego składnika mi tutaj najbardziej brakuje.
Alkohol jest bardzo wyraźny, mocny. Drażni w gardle i w podniebieniu. Z pewnością to jeden z tych elementów, który wymaga gruntownej poprawy. Goryczka jest także dość wyraźna, stanowi połączenie nut owocowych i alkoholowych.
Tekstura nienaganna, gęsta, zbita.
Wysokie wysycenie potęguje uczucie zapychania. Po przełknięciu czuć musowanie na języku. 
 Wysycenie:  Wysokie. Stanowczo zbyt wysokie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Jest to Limitowana Edycja piwa bazowego Natt leżakowana w beczkach po whiskey Jack Daniels.

Zacznijmy od dobrych stron trunku.
Przede wszystkim beczka, beczka i jeszcze raz beczka.
Zaraz po zrzuceniu firmowej czapeczki aromat bezsprzecznie alarmuje z jaka beczka mamy do czynienia. 
Jest mnóstwo nut whiskey, dębiny, wanilii, drewna.
Jest też fajna słodka kontra w postaci karmelu i toffi.
W smaku mamy także sporo nut beczkowych, odrobina tylko słodyczy i minimum czekolady.
Jeden z podstawowych elementów Imperial Porteru gdzieś zaginął.
Przechodząc do negatywnych cech tego piwa. Alkohol na tym poziomie jest absolutnie nie do zaakceptowania. Tym bardziej dla piwa z tak wysokimi notami i Top20 Imperial Porters.
Alkohol drażni, szczypie, wyraźnie wychodzi przed szereg.
Kolejnym mankamentem jest wysokie wysycenie, które w mig sprawia, ze piwo staje się zapychające.
No cóż wysokie miejsce na RB, niczego nie gwarantuje.
Tak czy inaczej - piwo potencjał do leżakowania ma.
Zakopcie je na dnie swoich piwniczek i opiszcie wrażenia za rok, czy dwa.

0,5l bottle at home from Boxbeers. Didnt find a BB date. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells of bourbon, wood, caramel, dried fruits, raisins, nutty, marzipan, licorice, some sherry, light coffee, some sticky molasses notes, overall very nice smell. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of bourbon, wood, some sherry, light sweetness, some dried fruits, licorice, some coconut, some alcohol noticeable, light vanilla, earthy. finishes lightly dry and bitter with notes of bourbon, licorice and some alcohol. very nice one, alcohol is a bit too noticeable for me though.

Bottle @ Wordenskjolds. Appearance: clear black with good beige soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, coffee, alcohol, oak, bourbon and chocolate, 
palette: strong roasted malty aroma, medium carbonation, full body, notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by an average to notable bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall - very good imp porter with a bourbon twist.
@ fillepolo 20161210. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty, caramely and sweet, vanilla and bourbon, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is roasted and sweet.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with vanilla and sweet BA character. Dry finish

Nice sweet cola/JD aroma. Chocolate, oak, dark fruits and lots of JD without being overwhelming. Super well-balanced. Light almost thin palate but the taste is robust and full, a nice contrast. This is a winner and a great example of how to BA.

On tap @ Bergen Juleølfestival 2016. Dark as night, as should come as no surprise give the name. Scents of whiskey, chocolate malt, butterscotch, herbs, roasted nuts. Taste is rich, creamy and handles well the mix between whiskey and beer. An accomplished cool Irish (or American, perhaps) coffee!
Short brown head. Big chocolate aroma with a touch of vegetables. Huge body with sweet chocolate and a mild bitterness.

Csodás dán imperial porter, valahogyan már előzetesen sejthető volt, hogy versenyre kel majd amerikai vetélytársaival. A Jack Daniels hordókkal kötött barátsága miatt nyilvánvalóan nem indult behozhatatlan hátránnyal, legyen tehát bármennyire is felkapott manapság a hordóérlelés mutatványa, jómagam nem bánnám, ha soha nem csengene le ez a fajta hóbort a sörfőzők részéről. Így tehát alkalmam volt újfent megtapasztalni, milyenek is a vaníliakrémes, kókuszreszelékes aromák egy sörben, melyek alól csak egy vékonyka marcipános foszlány szűrődik ki, amolyan imperial porteresen, az egész illatkompozíció elegáns, nem túl hivalkodó, kecses jegyekből áll azonban össze, bár visszafogottnak a legkevésbé sem lenne értelme nevezni az aromakölteményt. Ez a rész kipipálva, innen már nagy meglepetés nem is érhet bennünket, legalábbis a kellemetlenebb fajtából, s bár az ízjegyek remekül továbbfonják a megkezdett szálakat, az előző fázist mégsem szárnyalják túl. A műfaj vonatkozásában közepestől valamivel súlyosabbnak nevezhető szurokfekete teste feszes, intenzív kortyokból tevődik össze, az ázott hordós, háncsos, faleveles, whisky-s elemek vehemensen fortyognak benne, az alkohol csípős ostorcsapásai terelik egybe azokat, hogy egy mandulás, enyhén füstös, faleveles-komlós lenyomatot, majd elismerő csettintéseket hagyjanak maguk után.

Pours dark with tan head. Heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, caramel, chocolate, vanilla. Alcohol gives it a very nice body. Very creamy and delicious. Long sweet aftertaste. Dont drink too cold. Really matures in the glass.

Pours a deep rusty dark brown with a beige half finger faom. Really nice aroma right off the bat with a Cuba libra-ish (Coca-cola sirup) bourbon and hints of roasted malt, light vanilled oak and rum raisin chocolate. The taste is well ballanced with both initial sweetness, some bourbon soaked dark fruits, bitter chocolate. The flavours are light to medium rich and the mouthfeel is fairly light. Aftertaste is lingering with some roasted malt, bourbon spice and oak tannins. Lives up to expectations and then some.

Lynchburg Natt jest czarno wiśniowy i nie przepuszcza światła, piana jest minimalna, podobnie jak jego wysycenie. Zapach suszonych owoców miesza się z winną owocowością, kwaskowością wiśni, mleczną czekoladą. Uderza aromat drewna kojarzący mi się bardziej z bourbonem niż whiskey. Mimo 10% alkoholu piwo jest bardzo delikatne i oleiste. Gładko wchodzi, ale absolutnie nie chce się go pić szybko. W smaku kawa przeplata się z czekoladą, a nuta paloności przypomina zapach wioski spalonej przed tygodniem. Wiśnie zmieniają się w sherry i dochodzi wanilia. Fenomenalne!

duft: vanilje sødlig karamel lidt ege 
smag: sød vanilje karamel lidt rosin svag alkohol
From bottle. Sweet bourbon, malty, vanilla, oak. Dark brown, tan head. Taste is moderate sweet and light+ sweet. Full body, oily, sweet bourbon finish.
Bottle thanks to Eric. Pours a very dark brown with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong whiskey, wood, roast. Medium body, creamy, cocoa, roast, dark chocolate, boozy finish, very good.
Nästintill kolsvart, litet brunt skum. Doft: Kola, choklad, malt, kanderat socker, söt bourbon, söt fatlagring, söt lakrits, knäck. Smak: Som doft i stort fast godare.

Bottle. Pours Black with a beige head. Aroma of vanilla, toffee, chocolate and sligt boozy barrel character. Though gentle and smooth aroma. Taste of roasted malts, liquorice, vanilla, savory notes, bitter chocolate and some oak.

01-MAY-2016, bottle @Banksia with the job. Cannot remember the date.
Following the regular from tap I ordered this. 
Dark, dark, Brown with a low tan head.
Aroma is Bourbon, roast, Vanilla. Taste the same with chocolate, alcohol. Not as full as the regular from tap initially but comes together after 15 minutes in the glass. Really good.

Bottle found at a local night shop in copenhagen. Poured deep dark Brown with a tanned head on top. Big fruit notes upfront, deep dark cherries, chocolate, wooden oak notes, sweet Jack daniels, sweet candied sugar, raisins, sweet aftertaste. Pretty Impressive brew
Small sample from bottle. 2007 Vintage - Aroma has huge chocolate syrup, bourbon, vanilla, oak. Flavor is delicious and smooth. Reminds me of BCBS actually, thats how good this beer is!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of vanilla, oak roast, coffee, liquorice. Sweetish vanilla and oak flavor with chocolate, roast, raisins. Surprisingly thin body but still enough to make it creamy and packed with flavor.
Bottle 0,5. Pours black. Roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, caramel, black berries. Full body, oily but not sticky texture, soft carbonation.
Svart öl med ett beige skum. Doft och smak av rostad malt, vanilj, ek, bourbon och choklad.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Aroma: wine, vanilla, barrel, iodine, salt, coffee, chocolate, sweet and very good. Flavor: vanilla, coffee, chocolate, wine, oil, candies and dried fruits.
Brown color, medium beige head. Sweet and acidic aromas. Vanilla, syrup, wood, corn. Sweet bourbon flavors, vanilla, slight acidic, corn syrup, caramel, raisins. Alcoholic finish.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av choklad, kaffe, rostade toner, vanilj, rom-russin, ekfat, karamell, brunt socker och bourbon. Stor sötma, rund och len med fin beska.
Flaska från SB. Fina fattoner från bourbonen med vanilj, ek, russin, Till det söt mörk chokladtårta spesad med rom russin. Aningen tunn kropp för att klara lagringen. Annars riktigt bra.
Bottle.Almost black colour with small off beige head.Nice taste of vanilla and bourbon and sweet dried fruits,oily power full mouthfeels and hint of coffee and wood.

BIG thanks to bergstaden for this monster. My last bottle from Ægir and its an absolute gem.At cellar temperature and into a snifter. Inky black and headless aside a tannish ring on the meniscus. Deeply nutty is the nose and brimming with notes of Madeira, cola soda, stewed rhubarb, vanillin, cellar must, fatty biltong, marzipan and nougat. Lighter than expected on the palate. Well attenuated. The alcohol restrained to a light warmth in the finish. Nutty, oaken with a fruity, vinous sweetness to the front. Chocolate and charred wood, marzipan and a spicy, peppery prickle to the tail hinting at the bourbon barreling. A sourness draws on the saliva glands but it is balanced and harmonious with hints of vanilla and sweet berries. Plenty of malt character but it is the ageing that is key here. Wonderful depth, the aroma playing straight into the taste really gripping the olfactories. I loved this one. Really wish I had tried it fresh with another sample to compare. Artisinally made perfection. (2012 vintage, 50cL)

Bottle at Banksia, Copenhagen. Poured almost black with a round light tan head. The aroma is big red berry fruit, sweet malt, fake sugar. The flavour is moderate sweet with a rich smooth alcoholic sweet malt, big fruit palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation. A really super beer and quite a find.
Bottle shared at Banksia. Black with a small tan head. Aroma shows up the JD barrel upfront, woody notes, dark chocolate, fudge and caramel. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

500 ml bottle courtesy of Nils. Black color with beige brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, dark dried fruits, chocolate, licorice, light coffee, caramel, some butterscotch notes, wood, vanilla, Sweet and bitter like aroma milk chocolate, lot of vanilla, some spicy notes, light smoked notes too. Medium to full silky oily body with soft carbonation.

May 6, 2016. Bottle.
Black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma is bourbon, caramel, prunes, vanilla, some dark chocolate. Taste is sweet, smooth bitter, slight warming alcohol. Finish is sweet malty with dark sugars, prunes, caramel, hints of vanilla, soft bitter roasted notes, a touch of licorice and lasting warming bourbon alcohol. Medium bodied, smooth small bubble carbonation. 
Nice one!

Pours black with a low off white head. Aromas of dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, muscovado sugar, roasted malt. Taste is quite sweet with earthy barrel notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation.

Aroma is rich from the barrel notes. Bourbon, vanilla and wood. Also coffee and raisins. Taste is sweet, roasted malts, licorice, dried dark fruits. I dont like that tiny sour twist in the end though. I guess its from the barrel ageing? Sour wood. Other than that, good stuff.

Bottle from SB.
Dark brown, almost black, thick slow building tanned head.
Sweet chocolate sauce and bourbon aroma. Slight hard boozy woody from the bourbon, but overall fairly smooth.
Taste is sweet and meaty with chocolate, slight tar and licorice, bourbon and vanilla. Dry warming finish.
Big body, soft carbonation, oily silky texture.
Big and sweet, distinct flavours, quite balanced and drinkable. Good stuff!

Very dark brown with almost no head. Sweet gentle aroma of vanilla and honey. The taste is sweet vanilla and honey as well but also smooth chocolate and coffee flavors. A gentle bitterness in the finish offers balance. Really the moneys worth in flavor.
Flaska systembolaget. Svartbrun kulör med beiget skum. Komplex doft av fat, knäck, rostad malt, kaffe, vanilj och bourbon. Samma i smak med eftertouch av choklad. Varm och len munkänsla

Pours dark with low off white head 
Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, caramel, milk chocolate, dried fruits 
Taste has bourbon, vanilla, dried fruits, brown sugar, hints of milk chocolate 
Smooth, medium body, low carbonation, no bitterness
A: Dark brown/black with a light brown head. N: Bourbon, vanilla, coconut, coffee T: Coconut, vanilla, chocolate, hint of coffee O: Hardcore barrel aging. Nice!

Vanilje træ chokolade rør sukker 
Bitter lidt sød moderate 
Oile flad

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a tanned head. Now first the aroma, this is s treat, Jack D, vanilla, sherry, cherries, hints of chocolate and smoke. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Rich taste of oak, bourbon, vanilla, cherries, cigar smoke, chocolate. Warm but not strong finish. Great!

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with stable ligt tan head. Clear aroma of roast, malt and barrel, with notes of fruit. Sweetish flavour of caramel malt, fruit, roast and coffee, with pronounced notes of vanilla and barrel and touches of yeast. Lingering, barellike aftertaste with notes of fruit. Creamy mouthfeel. Perfect. Just great.

Lots of bourbon, rather boozy, vanilla and fudge, honey, lightly roasty, raisin, coffee, chocolate and vanilla.
Black colour, medium tan head, lacing.
Salty, heavily sweet, medium bite, lots of bourbon and actually lightly boozy.
Fullbodied, soft carbonation, warming finish.
Enjoyable.

Pours black with a small whitish ring of persistent bubbles. Nose of whiskey, fresh oak, coconut, dark sugar syrup, dates, vanilla, a little chocolate. Flavour is rather sweet but not cloying, just with very low bitterness. Dark caramel, prunes and dates, whiskey, vanilla, light coconut, soft chocolate notes, wood. Finish is slightly drier but still low on bitterness, more impression from whiskey and wood, a bit of cola, spirit flavours but not much actual alcohol heat. Fairly full mouthfeel with extremely low carbonation. The low roast bitterness is to style and makes it feel really elegant, barrel isnt completely overbearing. Nice stuff!

Just amazing! Complex imperial stout, aroma of dark chocolate with loads of vanilla and bourbon. Smooth taste, low carbonation. The vanilla and bourbon taste really coming through. Warm alcohol and wood aftertaste. Would be even better in slightly smaller bottles.

Bottle, 10%. Distinct and pungent vanilla aroma, hint of fruit and spirits, perhaps whiskey. Black colour, seems cloudy. Semi-large light brown head, but very unstable. The flavour is quite sweet and has a distinct vanilla note and a nicely boozy finish. In short, the flavour is a lot like the aroma.
Bottle at Hoarders Society Meeting Odense. Dark brown body with a small offwhite head. Bourbon, roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate. Surprisingly good.
Norsk når det er bedst! Samme farve som deres eksistensgrundlag, og lige så balanceret som deres velfærdssystem! Kanon

Bottle. Pours black with a Off white head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, roast, choco, dark choco, very balanced. Taste is dark choco, coffee, bouebon, subtile notes of caramel, vanilla nothing o er top, very balanced. Waiw.

From bottle @ Hoarders Society Meeting Odense. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of vanilla, oak, light chocolate, coffee. Taste is smooth and oily, chocolate, vanilla, oak, light coffee, notes og roasted malts. Lovely, and a huge surprise at this tasting!!!
Bottle @ Odense Hoarder Society Meeting, 2016. Pours black with a small creamy head. Roast, wood, whisky, coffee. Slick and vinous. Proper!

Aroma: dark berries and ripe fruits. Sweet prunes. 
Flavour: sweet prunes and dark berries with a warm alcoholic mouthfeel. 
Colour: very dark reddish brown with an offwhite head.

Bottle from Voldby. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, wood and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with some alcohol. Oily. 130216
Bottle. Tiny tan head. Black opaque body. Smoked wood, soy sauce and vanilla. Some yeasty aroma. An explosion of flavor in the mouth! Slightly salty on the tongue.

Bottle @ DØE. Pours very dark brown with a small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, wood, light coconut, light whisky. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, dark chocolate, light coffee, coconut, vanilla, whisky, alcohol. Full body, average carboantion, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 200116

Bottle @ NFL night. Pour is oily pitch black with a dark tan head. Tons of bourbon notes, sweet syrupy, vanilla, chocolate fudge, caramel, coconut and some light booze. A tad too sweet but still very good!

Bottle, 10%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon and a little vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, little vanilla, sweet, hop, medium bitter and caramel.

Bottle. Black with a small beige head. Nose has bourbon; vanilla, coconut, white wood. Light roasted malt beneath it. Flavour is also dominated by bourbon; coconut, vanilla, cotton candy, white wood, white chocolate, warming and light stinging alcohol. Full body, oily/sticky texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet, light acidic and bitter. Very bourbon dominated and a bit thin, but also soft and not rough. Fair. Gets sticky as it warms up.

Bottle from Voldby. Pours black with a good beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, wood, vanilla notes. Full body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Nice light bitter finish with bourbon notes.

Bottle from Voldby Købmandsgaard shared with the in-laws Hammel, DK - Black pour with dense slowly dissipating tan head. Roasted malty aroma and taste, some prominent chocolate and caramel sweetness to balance the strong burnt roasty notes, jack Daniels infused wooden nuances, subtle vanilla laced throughout, lovely stuff this. Great Christmas treat.

Bottled 500ml (from Viking Grace Aug 2015, sampled at Christmas Eve)
Dark, opaque brown color, small steady beige head. Toasted malty, oxidized notes, some bourbon. Medium-bodied. Roasted malts, raisins, evident Jack Daniels notes, even a bit of vanilla. Straightforward JD barrel aged.

Bottle. Pours a Dark, reddish brown with a small, slightly fizzy head. Aroma is bourbon, roast, toast, vanilla, caramel, slight cola. Taste is roasty, sweet, slight booze, bourbon, light bitter finish. Malt and bourbon. Fairly High carbonation, medium oily body.good stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Stor smag og fylde. Fuld smæk på alle sanser i denne øl. Humlen er fin i denne. God øl.

500ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is woody, whiskey, vanilla roasted malt, brown sugar, prunes, raisins, chocolate and leather. Flavour is sweet and light bitter. Full boded, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet, barrel and whiskey.

Hazy, nearly black with a small light tan head. Aroma has wood, chocolate, vanilla and notes of sweet licoirice. Smooth mouthfeel with light alcoholic bite. Flavour has caramel, cocoa, chocolate, more vanilla and wood. Dry and lasting, sweet bitterness. Nice.

(Aegir Lynchburg Natt) Bottle 500 ml at home, from a trade. Served into a snifter and tasted side to side with the non barrel aged version. ABV 10%
Black colour on the body, small and a bit thin, dark brown head, with low retention.
Aroma has lots of bourbon, alcohol, vanilla, wood, hints of chocolate.
Taste has bourbon, alcohol, vanilla, chocolate, less dark fruits than the non BA but still there.
Medium to thick body, soft carbonation, sticky on the palate.
Very nice.

Flaske 500ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø Sentrum. Drukket i Skibotn 13 Aug 15. Svart. Lavt filmskum. Samling langs glasset. Behagelig aroma av sjokolade & lakris. Smaken innholdsrik. Svisker. Lakris. Mandeldråper. Utmerket koseøl.
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon and coffee. A flavor of chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, sweets and coffee.

Black color, light brown head. Caramel nose, wood, malty, licorice, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, hint of dried fruit. Roasted malt taste, brown sugar, wood, sweet licorice, caramel, hint of alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 15.06.15. Very dark brown. Small, beige head. Dark caramel, liquorice, oak and vanilla in aroma. Similar taste. Still drinkable.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours dark brown with very small head. Aroma of whisky, liquorice, vanilla, wood, dark dried fruits, alcohol. Taste sweet and fruity-sherry, alcohol, a little salt.

500ml bottle. Pours out black with a small brown head. Nose is bourbon and red fruits. Taste on the sweet side but not overly so. Smooth, low carb. Barrel isnt overpowering and ties it together nicely. Doesnt feel harsh or boozy. Very easy to drink. Good stuff; barrel clearly worked well.

How: Bottle Appearance: Almost black, small brown head. Aroma: Smoke, dark berries, prunes, raisins,, sherry, dark caramel, cherries, bitter chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Palate: Full bodied, soft carbonation. Close to perfection.
Mye mjølkesjokolade, mest i lukt men också i smak. Kan kænna mycket alkohol. God och rund och lång eftersmak.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, nose is chocolate, liquorice, bourbon, taste is sweet liquorice and chocolate.

Smooth som karamell. Man känner Jack Daniels faten & karamelliserad smak. Len som grädde mot tungan som lägger sig kvar & suger som en fin karamell. Russin & lite barley Wine:ad. Helt enkelt magisk av choklad. Smälter som en stenugn.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50 cl. bottle. Thanks Mike. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and bourbon. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, bourbon, and vanilla. The Jack Daniels does not dominate the taste or aroma. I found the barrel aging almost perfect.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 Bottle at home. Poured a dark brown with no head. But still a lively beer. I get the traditional chocolate and dark cherries notes in the nose. But also quite heavily the barrel. This also reflected in the taste which was bitter and quite dry. Feels like a tannic wine in that respect . Great. (Second rating two years later new bottles. Milder barrel influence and a better beer.)
Very dark,as the name implies. Tastes off coffee, sour mash and leather. Not for the faint hearted. Stands best on its own.

Without shame I can say that I am a lazy "ticker". However, sometimes I miss that 6th star. It might be because I am too loose with my 5th haha. This beer is one that deserves my undevided attention, so the least I can say is this: If you like Bourbon BA stouts/porters with a full body and If you like sweet vanilla taste, then this is your cup of porter. It certainly is mine!

In my experience, Jack doesnt always work in beer, but this is solid. 500 ml bottle from Johns Market. Pours a pitch black color with a small beige head. a big sweet barrel nose, vanilla, oak, some leather. The flavor is mellow barrel, light rye, vanilla, toffee, dark fruit, some smoke. Cherries perhaps, darker fruits as well. The barrel is subtle sweet notes, nothing too harsh. Works very well. Mellow almost in terms of the drinkability. Solid.
500 ml bottle at Hasse. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma of bourbon, alcohol, raisins, dark malt and wood. Taste is similar, lots of alcohol, boozy and wood

A wonderfuk piwo. Really, First I thought again about another high abv strong piwo just a bit of coffee. But this is better. Way better. Offering some plums, some ripe fruits, here: berries, and a nice touch of spice. Warming you up for a whole evening. Thumbs up.

Bottle from Henrik - thank you for this christmas gift, Mr. C :-) the beer has got a deep black colour with an low unsteady beige head and smooth body. Looks like a moonless night. Wonderful, perfect aroma of wine, mild whiskey,ooak, plums and chocolate. Taste of warm, lightly sweetened coffee,rrum raisins, raisins, whiskey, ripe plums, chocolate, malt and barley. Oaky and woody aftertaste, followed by a smooth and warming finish. High quality beer. Loved it.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis. Nose is straight booze chocolate. Some fudge and sugar as it warms. Nearly black in color with a small light khaki head. Holy whata damn taste. First thing I think is barrel aged nesquick. Chocolate dominates with a light bitterness. Huge chewy thick mouthfeel without being cloying or sticky. Just a tad of carbonation. Chocolate dream come true without being overly sweet or artificial or roasted. The booze is there to aid in complexity and not totally dominate. A very well made and well balanced beer. One of the best porters I have had. Worth the $17 or whatever it was. Alcohol is very well hidden. A gem.

Pours a deep brown, resembles a flat Coca-Cola in the glass. No head for some reason, perhaps kept in the fridge too long. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate and slight nuts. Taste is chocolate which gives this a bitter dimension, the bourbon sweetness follows and the finish reminds of hazelnuts with some salty accents there too. Creamy texture, medium bodied.

Black, but actually dark dark copper-brown. Slowly gushing foam, big tan bubbly head, diminishes into a tiny layer. Poor lacing if you sip slowly, few disturbed crochets otherwise.
Aroma; roasted malts, liquorice, fermented berry juice, wet wood (maybe oak), fruity spices.
Taste; dark malts, dark fruitiness, strong bitter fruity peels, tannic acid, fruity spices cinnamon-vanilla alike, fermented liquorice, confused plum, some fruity booze, dark fruity chocolate notes.
Good body, modest carbonation, powerful but in balance, good feeling. Fine fading finish, from bitter-sweet to sweet.
Very expensive, should be drunk slowly in order to getting ones money worth.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Served in a large snifter. Dark brown body, with hints of red colour. A tiny tan to brown head. Alcohol, ripe fruit and some wineous nose. Silky smooth, medium to thick body. Warming alcohol. Quite a lot of bitterness. Hint of sweetness. Prune and raisin, vanilla, red fruit and berries, some apple and alcohol, chocolate and hint of alcohol flavour. Nice and smooth beer, but I think the non-barrel aged one is a bit better.

Malty, rich, fullbodied, smooth and balanced with an impressive complexity. Gives me associations to milk stouts but with the depth of a westvleteren 12! The subtle smoked bourbon blends in perfectly and I get a nice hint of vanilla from the oak barrels. My favourite Norwegian beer.

Bottle shared at BBF14. Pours deep brown, small light marroon head. Aroma of chocolate and raisins. Sweetness in the nose reveealed as with honey. Full body, creamy and silky. Taste is rich dark chocolate, figs and dried plums, honey. Nice beer!

Bottle shared at Borefts. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is chocolate, honey, dates, raisins, wood. Full bodied, velvetty mouthfeel, smooth and rich on the palate, long sweet finish. Taste is chocolate, honey, raisins, dates, hint of wood.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2014 0,5 pullo@ Hermanna.Lähes musta, tummanruskea, öljyinen ja sameahko. Tuoksuu todella suklaiselle! Myös brandya.  Mutakakku tulee mieleen. Makukin hyvin suklainen, täyteläinen, humalaa, pikkuisen kirpeyttä ja viskiä.

.5l bottle from Alko Arkadia 
Pours black with no head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, dark, alcohol. Syrup. Flavor is dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, some hops, dark fruits, whisky notes. Swell!

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2014 0,5l bottle from the flagship Alko. Pours dark amber with a very low head. Aroma is surprisingly weak, sweet roasted malts with some alcohol. Flavor is sweet roasted malts with some dark fruits and warm alcohol. Nice.
(171214) The aroma is not really so weak, so one step up there.

"jack daniels? never would have guessed by the softness of the flavor and feel of this beer. Exceptionally soft and smooth on the palate, robust flavor of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, whisky, roast and faint graham cracker. similar aroma, maybe even a little mellower. quite delicious."

50cl bottle pours a murky, deep brown with some creamy, ringing, beige head. Id put up this nose against some of the best barrel aged stouts and porters out there. Mild booze, a little corn, vanilla, coconut, raisin, pencil lead, cherry cordial, mild smoke, licorice. Flavor is malty, sweet, black licorice, quite a bit of molasses, prunes, raisins, cherries, vanilla, caramel, mild coconut. The licorice presence tips the hand that this is a Euro-beer. Finishes incredibly smooth, and oily, lightly sweet. Very well done.

My birthday beer this year! Pours a clear body with a brown to copper colour that is so dark that its almost black. The light-brown head is tiny, short-lived and doesnt leave much lacing. Sweet, roasted and strong aroma of dark caramel, dark chocolate, well integrated whiskey (yup, this is definitely not peaty Scotch whisky), with pleasant notes of vanilla and dark dried fruits in the back. Delicious and strong flavour of huge amounts of dark chocolate, dark caramel, gentle un-peated whiskey. Also some coffee, extremely well integrated alcohol, and faint hints of apricot kernels. Moderate sweet taste with a moderate bitterness in the long finish. The body isnt as full as Id expected from a beer with this high ABV. The texture is oily and the carbonation is very, very soft, too close to flat for my liking. Still, a wonderful brew, although maybe not worth the 240 NOK I payed for this one. 
[50 cl bottle, batch 160LYN, bottle 225, enjoyed 4 years after brewing, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]
Rich, inky black pour. Nice brown head. Thick and quite delicious. Bourbon is prominent, chocolate persists throughout, a nice structured roast fills this one out nicely. Really good.

Bottle from Corvallis Brew Supply, Corvallis. Pours a medium dark brown with slight tan head. Nose huge, booze, wood, smooth. Sharp, acidic. Body full and fluffy, burning after taste, but complexity of barrels is lovely.

Bottle (thanks hermod!). Black. Dark roasted, woody, bourbony oaky, with some soy. Surprisingly easy body for the full nose. Med full, but easily palatable, no abv nor stickyness. Real nice one. An oaky, dry chocolate, dangerously easily drunk.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle 50 CL. Pours black ,with brown white lacing head. Notes of mämmi, bread, coffee, chocolate. Easy to drink. Hides the alcohol very well.

50cl bottle. Black color, brown thin head. Vanilla, sweetness, wood, licorice aroma. Flavor has vanilla, sweetness, bourbon, caramel. Long vanilla finish. Excellent stuff.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

500 ml bottle. Pours a black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roastiness, wood, bourbon and vanilla. Rich flavour of roastiness, vanilla, smooth bourbon notes, caramel, some bitterness and wood. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. Soft. Extremely well balanced.

50 cl bottle.
Pours color with head. Aroma is very lovely, borubon, vanilla and some chocolate, dark malts, licorice and some faint soy. Flavor of licorice, vanilla, bourbon, dark chocolaty malts, some faint soy and some sugar. Excellent balance, very tasty.
5327

500ml bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki

Pours dark brown, almost black with a smooth bubbly head. Aroma of roasty malts, bourbon, wood, vanilla, oak, coffee, dark chocolate and cocoa. Taste is smooth, woody and bourbony with some roastiness, dark chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Finish is sweet, syrupy and roasty with some dark chocolate, bourbon, wood and vanilla notes. Pretty good.

(Bottle) Black colour with creamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with coffee, oak wood, hints of bourbon, honey, prunes, vanilla, coffee and liquorice. Malty, roasted taste with notes of coffee, chocolate, oak wood, bourbon, honey, vanilla, prunes, raisins, toffee, liquorice, tobacco, a touch of peat and a finish with a balanced bitterness and a hint of alcohol. Almost full body, fairly sweet. Tasty and quite well balanced with alcohol fairly well hidden. Very nice.

DWS; Pours dark brown to black. Aroma is to much whiskey and oaky for my liking. Dark fruits and vanilla suits me better, not to mention roasted malt and plums, brunes. Coffe and chocolate as it warms, in loads. Taste is sweet fruity and moderate bitter, absolutely lasting. Body is full, texture is creamy, carbonation is flat to soft. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bourbon vanilla aroma. Super smooth moutfeel of balanced bourbon, vanilla, chocolate and cereal or something like dried nuts and a small hint of rausins. Very short aftertaste. Medium body.
Bottle. Dark brown, almost black with a beige head. Orange zest, marzipane and chocolate nose. The fabulousness continues in the mouth with an elegant, dry finish. Perfect night cap.
Sweet taste together with roasted malt, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, dried red fruits. Sweet finish with alcoholic feeling.
Malty aroma with a whiff of heat and bourbon. Complex palate. Nicely balanced. Fantastic impy

500 ml bottle shared with Skullspliter amd Calm_Dreamer at The Hoppy Pub, Thesalloniki Greece (bottle from trade with Gunnar, thanks again man!!!)
Black body with a thin brown head. bourbon, vanilla and some oak on the aroma. Taste was phenomenal. Bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, resins, plums. Short aftertaste, pretty sweet. Full body with low to medium carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2015 Svart med minimalt skum. Aromaen er flust med vanilje, samt malt og sjokolade. Smaken er også dominert av vanilje. Også kaffe, malt, sjokolade, lakris og litt alkohol finnes i smaken. Rund og god, til tross for 10 prosent alkohol. Godt balansert. Søt i starten, så litt bitter. Vaniljen er hele tiden hovedpersonen, også i den medium bitre ettersmaken. Denne passer sikkert utmerket til konfekt eller annen mørk sjokolade. Jeg drakk min til Freia melkesjokolade, og det fungerte perfekt!

From a shared 50cl bottle at RBNG-14. Pours very dark, close to black with almost no head. Lots of vanilla and oak, dark malts and some dark fruits. Nice full body, pleasant and balanced. A bit too sweet for my taste, but an excellent night cap. (2014-02-15 - Halden)

Pours black with a bubbly cappuccino-colored head. Sparse lacing. Nose is rich and and sweet, reminiscent of caramel and nougat with notes of coconut. Taste is mildly sweet with coffee and cream notes. Medium body. Good brew.
Bottle 50cl. Small brown head disappearing. Opaque. Aroma is sugar, oak, whiskey and plums. Taste is chocolate, cookies, dark bread and whiskey.

Flaske fra polet, hjemme på bursdagen: i samme øyeblikk som korken vippes av stiger forventningene parallelt med den herlige aromaen. Cremeskum, oljet flyt, og en portvinsvinøs smak med kompleksitet i internasjonal klasse. Munnfylde og ettersmak følges ad. Nå er jeg i komfortsonens hovedmanesje. Dyr, superb og verdt hver eneste krone.
Dark brown pour, small brown head. Aroma of roasted coffee, liqorice and some sugar cane and peat. Taste of sweet liqorice and delicious coffee roast. Very balanced and deep.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016 Old rating rerated 25.12.2013, 0,5l bottle (1st batch bottle #267) @ home:
Small brown slightly bubbly longlasting head. Aroma is very rich and balanced, raw licorice, mild bourbon, dark sugar, caramel, dark malts, vanilla, espresso, cocoa, oak. Taste is very rich and velvety, slightly sweet, licorice, dark malts, dark sugar, mild bourbon, chocolate, sour coffee, oak, caramel, vanilla. Medium to longlasting bitterness, thick sticky mouthfeel. Very nice, close to perfection. 

Also had a bottle of a fresher third batch after the first one. The aroma is very neutral and kind of dry oaky. The taste is more in the same direction as the first one, but not as rich, and more dry oaky. The score would end at 5-4-7-4-12=3,2. A brief shadow of the first batch sadly.

Bottle, bought @ Nordisk Ølhandel, Cph. Pours dark brown with a fine, staying, creamy, beige film head. Aroma has oak, light roasted, dark chocolate, vanilla. Low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has oak, vanilla, light vinious, dark chocolate, tar, hazelnuts, vanilla. Fine dry finish.

Bottle nr 0276. Pours dark brown but is pretty pitch black in the glass. Low head formation, but there is a small one. Mellow bourbon aroma with leather and woody notes. Smooth and velvety on the palate. Taste is also very smooth; balanced sweetness, dark coffee and moderate roasty. Aftertaste is lingering bourbon. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
(500ml bottle) Pours a black body with a small beige head. Aroma of wood, ash, chocolate, and roasted malt. Flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, ash, caramel, anise, vanilla, and wood.

0, 5L bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours dark brown, with thin beige head. The aroma fills the room instantly, this is one intense beer. Sweet caramel malt, licorice, brown sugar, spicy, vanilla, honey, whisky liqueur, dark dried fruits, slightly smokey. Very well balanced, so the palate is very much the same as the aromas, with the addition of chocolate. Reminds me a bit of a barley wine. Cant really feel the alcohol, even at 10%. Pretty close to the perfect beer for me.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Oily black beer with big bubbled head on top, smallish lacing attaches to the sides. Aroma has milk coffee, cream, bourbon, some berries, sacher-cake. Taste has milk coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, wooden flavors and cream. Very oily body and medium-to-high carbonation. Well this is it, at least for me this has everything I look for in a bold Imperial Porter. Im going to increase my score from 4,8 to 4,9. If only the head wouldve been more pleasant to the eye this wouldve been a straight 5/5 beer.

50 cl bottle @ Olutexpo 2013
Aroma is sweet with strong bourbon notes, vanilla and sweet woody tones. Flavour has also sweet bourbon notes, vanilla, some licorice and wood. Also some coffee. Bourbon dominates here totally.
Cola svart farge med beige skum. Lukter kaffe, brunt brennevin og karamell. Smaker godt at denne har høy alkoholprosent. Fikk nesten følelsen som å drikke en cocnac. Liker denne godt.
Svart med beige høyt skum. Whiskey, kaffe, sjokolade og lakris og røkt lukt. Smaker også alt fra lukten. Dette var rett og slett en nydelig øl. Takk svigers som kjøper øl i bursdagsgave.

Bottle: &nbsp Deep brown, cola hues, thin to moderate frothy tan head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Soft bourbon nose, charred wood, roasted malts, a touch of vanilla. &nbsp Bourbon like start, roasty, dark pitted fruit... this seems almost a stout. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate. &nbsp Smooth roasty finish, bourbon, slight vanilla. &nbsp Also has a big of dark pitted fruit that lingers well after the finish, along with very light alcohol. &nbsp Good stuff!
Svart farve med noe beige skum langs kanten. Lukt av malt, sjokolade, vanilje. Smak av malt, sjokolade, frukt og whiskey . Vinmonopolet.
God duft av lakris, sjokolade, kaffe og krydder. Lite skum. Dyp sort farge. Nydelig sittende smak av lakris, sjokolade og kaffe. Drikkes gjerne igjen.
Flaske fra esp0r. Drukket på hytta til dag. Svart farge. Tynn skumrand. Kaffe,lakris,malt. Synes den er overpriset pg oppskrytt. Fortsatt god

Bottle thanks to bytemesis. Pours very dark brown/almost black with tan head. Nose and taste is smooth but heavy barrel, oak, vanilla, chocolate cookie, smooth whiskey, roast chocolate and milk chocolate. Medium body. Great balance. Tinge of alcohol in finish.
Bottle. Black with tan head. intense aroma of chocolate and licorice. Taste is rich chocolate and licorice. Sweet with a clean finish. Delish
Bottle at home... Deep black.. Thin tan head... Soft roast... Dark malts... Heavy roast.. Sweet malts... Chewy roast malt nose... Heavy sweet malts... Little barley wine like...

Bottle, many thanks to Cunningham.  Very dark brown color with thick espresso beige head. aroma of roasted malt, bourbon, ash, vanilla, caramel, wood. Sweet taste together with roasted malt, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, dried red fruits. Sweet finish with alcoholic feeling. Alcohol is evident, but not boozy. Tasty beer, I would like to taste regular Natt.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 Bottle at Mitchs stout tasting. Pours black with a small beige rim for a head. Some spotty lacing. Nose shows sweet oaky vanilla, light spice, heavy coconut and bourbon notes with stewed raisins. Works in great balance. Taste shows similar stewed fruit notes, vanilla accentuated with a great coconut note and balanced oak driven tones - vanilla coming through without overpowering. Fantastic creamy palate without being overly sweet. Finishes a little quick but to be expected with a porter. Really good stuff

Thanks to someone for sharing this at my pre-BTBF tasting. Brown pour with a white head. The aroma is full of roasted malt and smoke. The oak and whiskey notes really come through in the flavor where they are complimented by some chocolate and roasted malt character. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Aroma: Smelling of, coffee, cocoa, vanilla, chocolate, almonds.Appearance: A black one, a tan head leaving little lacing but good curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet vanilla chocolate, marzipan, Kahlua and some oak.Palate: Little carbonation, soft and sticky, a good body. Smooth finish.Overall: A bit too sweet, very liquerish.Note: Bottle at De Klomp sampling. Reviewed 2012-04-14.

Bottle @ Rooie Dop brewdungeon, thanks for sharing guys. Black colour, beige head. Nose is roasted malts, vanilla, bourbon, coffee. Flavour is roasted malts and coffee, vanilla, slightly boozy. Finish is fairly bitter. Really good stuff.
Bottle. Black colour with white lace. Bourbon, wood and vanilla aroma. Bourbon taste, also vanilla and roastnesa, aome chocolate and licorice. Full body.

500ml Bottle - Black with a tan head. Whisky, roasted malt, plain chocolate and liquorice in the aroma. Chocolatey, roasted, vinous and very rich taste with notes of plain chocolate, coffee, soapy hops and salt liquorice. Its so thick that its almost chewy!

0.5 l bottle, thanks hanniku! Almost black dark reddish brown color. Very oaky aroma with plenty of vanilla with sweet roastiness and perfumed alcohol. Sweet, oaky, roasty and boozy taste with licorice. Woody finish with red wine and whiskey. Fair too oaky.

Appearance: Black color with a small tan head.Aroma: Coffee, chocolate and some oak.Palate: Medium + body. Slightly sweet and a moderate bitterness. Soft carbonation. Creamy texture.Taste: Mild balanced chocolate, coffee, oak and roasted malt.Overall impression: Powerful and lovely ale.Personal stats: Sample @ Haand 13

Bottled. Dark color, short head. Aroma of dark malts, coffee, vanilla, hint of smoke. Nice complexity. Medium sweet, bit bitter. Again good balance between sweetness and dry bitter dark malts. Great stuff

pour very dark brown, no foam. coffee, malty in the smell

soft carbo, bourbon in the taste ( but still very gentle ) . sugary, sweet.
bottled, at BTBF pretaste, poured dark amber  brown, caramel, raisin aroma, flavor is malty caramel, raisin,  figs, pudding, lasting finish
